Title: Hotel Rwanda
Resume: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

Title: Tsotsi
Resume: Six days in the violent life of a young Johannesburg gang leader.

Title: The Last King of Scotland
Resume: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictatorIdi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

Title: The First Grader
Resume: The story of an 84 year-old Kenyan villager and ex Mau Mau veteran who fights for his right to go to school for the first time to get the education he could never afford.

Title: Beasts of No Nation
Resume: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.

Title: The Bang Bang Club
Resume: A drama based on the true-life experiences of four combat photographers capturing the final days of apartheid in South Africa.

Title: La battaglia di Algeri
Resume: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

Title: Sometimes in April
Resume: When the Hutu nationalists raised arms against their Tutsi countrymen in Rwanda in April 1994, the violent uprising marked the beginning of one of the darkest times in African history which resulted in the deaths of almost 800,000 people.

Title: Shooting Dogs
Resume: A Catholic Priest and an English teacher get stranded in a school in Kigali during the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

Title: Desert Flower
Resume: Waris Dirie, born 1965 in Somalia, flees at 13 when sold as 4th wife. She's maid at the Somalian embassy in London, then McDonald's, where she's discovered and becomes int'l top model. 1997, she speaks up against female genital mutilation.

Title: Jerusalema
Resume: A young hoodlum's rise from a small-time criminal to a powerful crime entrepreneur during the turbulent years before and after the fall of apartheid.

Title: Yesterday
Resume: After falling ill, Yesterday learns that she is HIV positive. With her husband in denial and young daughter to tend to, Yesterday's one goal is to live long enough to see her child go to school.

Title: Rebelle
Resume: Somewhere in Sub-Saharan Africa, Komona, a 14-year-old girl, tells her unborn child growing inside her the story of her life since she has been at war. Everything started when she was abducted by the rebel army at the age of 12.

Title: Timbuktu
Resume: A cattle herder and his family who reside in the dunes of Timbuktu find their quiet lives -- which are typically free of the Jihadists determined to control their faith -- abruptly disturbed.

Title: Queen of Katwe
Resume: A Ugandan girl sees her world rapidly change after being introduced to the game of chess.

Title: Zulu
Resume: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

Title: Blood Diamond
Resume: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.

Title: White Material
Resume: Amidst turmoil and racial conflict in a Francophone African state, a white French woman fights for her coffee crop, her family and ultimately for her life.

Title: Gorillas in the Mist: The Story of Dian Fossey
Resume: The story ofDian Fossey, a scientist who came to Africa to study the vanishing mountain gorillas, and later fought to protect them.

Title: Shaka Zulu
Resume: A historical account on the life of the Zulu King Shaka.

Title: Searching for Sugar Man
Resume: Two South Africans set out to discover what happened to their unlikely musical hero, the mysterious 1970s rock n roller,Rodriguez.

Title: Out of Africa
Resume: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

Title: Invictus
Resume: Nelson Mandela, in his first term as President of South Africa, initiates a unique venture to unite the Apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

Title: The English Patient
Resume: At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.

Title: Tears of the Sun
Resume: A Special-Ops commander leads his team into the Nigerian jungle in order to rescue a doctor who will only join them if they agree to save 70 refugees too.

Title: Machine Gun Preacher
Resume: Sam Childersis a former drug-dealing biker tough guy who found God and became a crusader for hundreds of Sudanese children who've been forced to become soldiers.

Title: The Good Lie
Resume: A group of Sudanese refugees, given the chance to resettle in the U.S., arrive in Kansas City, Missouri, where their encounter with an employment agency counselor forever changes all of their lives.

Title: Stander
Resume: The life and career of Andre Stander, a South African police officer turned bank robber.

Title: Tabu
Resume: A restless retired woman teams up with her deceased neighbor's maid to seek out a man who has a secret connection to her past life as a farm owner at the foothill of Mount Tabu in Africa.

Title: The Ghost and the Darkness
Resume: A bridge engineer and an experienced old hunter begin a hunt for two lions after they start attacking local construction workers.

Title: Die weiße Massai
Resume: A girl, Carola, whose vacation in Kenya takes an interesting turn when she becomes infatuated with a Masai. Carola decides to leave her boyfriend to stay with her lover. There, she has to ...See full summary»

Title: Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom
Resume: A chronicle of Nelson Mandela's life journey from his childhood in a rural village through to his inauguration as the first democratically elected president of South Africa.

Title: Nirgendwo in Afrika
Resume: A German Jewish refugee family moves to and adjusts to a farm life in 1930s Kenya.

Title: The Power of One
Resume: An English boy, living in Africa during World War II, through his boxing prowess, becomes a symbol of hope, in a time of war.

Title: The Constant Gardener
Resume: A widower is determined to get to the bottom of a potentially explosive secret involving his wife's murder, big business, and corporate corruption.

Title: The Siege of Jadotville
Resume: Irish Commandant Pat Quinlan leads a stand off with troops against French and Belgian Mercenaries in the Congo during the early 1960s.

Title: Cry, the Beloved Country
Resume: A South African preacher goes to search for his wayward son, who has committed a crime in the big city.

Title: Doa al karawan
Resume: This compelling tale of love and betrayal, set in the upper Egyptian countryside, follows the story of Amna as she plots her revenge on the engineer who destroyed her family's honor.

Title: Yeelen
Resume: A young man with magical powers journeys to his uncle to request help in fighting his sorcerer father.

Title: The Last Lions
Resume: Fifty years ago there were close to half-a-million lions in Africa. Today there are around 20,000. To make matters worse, lions, unlike elephants, which are far more numerous, have ...See full summary»

Title: Asmaa
Resume: A woman who suffers from AIDS decides not to surrender to the fatal disease. She exerts huge efforts in trying to recover or by helping those who suffer the same disease by giving them glimmers of hope.

Title: London River
Resume: Two strangers come to discover the fate of their respective children in the 2005 terrorist attacks on London.

Title: Lord of War
Resume: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.

Title: District 9
Resume: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

Title: Animals Are Beautiful People
Resume: Hilarious documentary on the wildlife of the Namib Desert.

Title: Ali Zaoua, prince de la rue
Resume: A group of children living on the street leave their gang, prompting retribution from the gang's leader. After one of the children dies, the rest try to come up with the resources to give their friend a proper burial.

Title: Zulu
Resume: Policemen Ali Sokhela and Brian Epkeen investigate the brutal murder of a young white woman, apparently provoked by the availability of a new illegal drug and somehow connected to the disappearance of black street children.

Title: When We Were Kings
Resume: Boxing documentary on the 1974 world heavyweight championship bout between defending champion,George Foreman, and the underdog challenger,Muhammad Ali.

Title: Sarafina!
Resume: South African teenagers fight against apartheid in the Soweto Uprising.

Title: The Gunman
Resume: A sniper on a mercenary assassination team kills the minister of mines of the Congo. Terrier's successful kill shot forces him into hiding. Returning to the Congo years later, he becomes the target of a hit squad himself.

Title: The Gods Must Be Crazy
Resume: A comic allegory about a traveling Bushman who encounters modern civilization and its stranger aspects, including a clumsy scientist and a band of revolutionaries.

Title: Sahara
Resume: Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.

Title: King Solomon's Mines
Resume: Adventurer Allan Quartermain leads an expedition into uncharted African territory in an attempt to locate an explorer who went missing during his search for the fabled diamond mines of King Solomon.

Title: Congo
Resume: When an expedition to the African Congo ends in disaster, a new team is assembled to find out what went wrong.

Title: Captain Phillips
Resume: The true story of CaptainRichard Phillipsand the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the U.S.-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.

Title: White Mischief
Resume: In 1940s Kenya, a married couple join other affluent British expatriates in a lifestyle of recklessness and excess, but soon find themselves in a troubling situation.

Title: Pumzi
Resume: A sci-fi film about Africa in the future, 35 years after World War III, the water war.

Title: Al-mummia
Resume: An Upper-Egyptian clan robs a cache of mummies and sells the artifacts on the illicit antiquities black market. After a conflict within the clan, one of its members goes to the police, helping the Antiquities Service find the cache.

Title: Coup de torchon
Resume: A pathetic police chief, humiliated by everyone around him, suddenly wants a clean slate in life - and resorts to drastic means to do so.

Title: Nairobi Half Life
Resume: A young, aspiring actor from upcountry Kenya dreams of becoming a success in the big city. In pursuit of this and to the chagrin of his brother and parents, he makes his way to Nairobi:the city of opportunity.

Title: Hævnen
Resume: The lives of two Danish families cross each other, and an extraordinary but risky friendship comes into bud. But loneliness, frailty and sorrow lie in wait.

Title: Kini & Adams
Resume: Kini and Adams are two friends leaving in a Zimbabwe village who dream of repairing an old broken car, and moving to the city and starting life over.

Title: Moolaadé
Resume: When a woman shelters a group of girls from suffering female genital mutilation, she starts a conflict that tears her village apart.

Title: Come Back, Africa
Resume: Come Back, Africa chronicles the life of Zachariah, a black South African living under the rule of the harsh apartheid government in 1959.

Title: Lumumba: La mort du prophète
Resume: Documentary about African political leader Patrice Lumumba, who was Prime Minister of Zaire (now Congo) when he was assassinated in 1961.

Title: Camp de Thiaroye
Resume: In this semi-autobiographical film, black soldiers help to defend France, but are detained in prison camp before being repatriated home.

Title: Kandisha
Resume: Shattered by the loss of her child, Nyla Jayde, a brilliant criminal defense attorney, takes on a case involving a 14th century Moroccan legend, a vengeful spirit named "Kandisha".

Title: Omaret yakobean
Resume: Meditations on corruption, fundamentalism, prostitution, homosexuality, and drugs in central Cairo.

Title: Al-massir
Resume: The story is set in the 12th century in Arab-ruled Spanish province Andalusia, where famed philosopher Averroes is appointed grand judge by the caliph and his liberal court judgments are ...See full summary»

Title: Zulu Dawn
Resume: A dramatization of the Battle of Isandlwana, where the British Army met its match against the Zulu nation.

Title: Asfour Stah
Resume: A coming-of-age comedy/drama set in Tunisia. Twelve-year-old Noura is an impressionable boy who must learn to reconcile two conflicting worlds - the loving world of Muslim women and the ...See full summary»

Title: The Naked Prey
Resume: During the 1800s, a safari guide, two elephant hunters and their crew run into trouble with the natives in the South African veld when they refuse to offer gifts to the tribesmen.
Unfolds the poignant story of three women and their search for justice from the daily plight of sexual harassment in Egypt.

Title: The Amazing Grace
Resume: The story of British slave trader John Newton's voyage to West Africa and the events that inspired him to write the world's most popular hymn, Amazing Grace.

Title: I Am Slave
Resume: A thriller set in London's slave trade and centered on a woman's fight for freedom.

Title: Red Dust
Resume: Police officer Dirk Hendricks files an amnesty application for Alex Mpondo, a member of the South African Parliament who can't remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist. South African-born attorney Sarah Barcant, meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo, as well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him and never heard from again.

Title: Country of My Skull
Resume: A journalist and a poetess meet during the hearings of South African Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

Title: Mountains of the Moon
Resume: The legendary true-story of Capt. Richard Francis Burton and Lt. John Hanning Speke's tumultuous expedition to find the source of the Nile river.

Title: Africa United
Resume: The story of four children who walk three thousand miles to get to the world cup. On the way they encounter many things such as HIV and child prostitution.

Title: Mister Johnson
Resume: In 1923, a local resident of British Colonial Nigeria tries to be equal with the colonial administration.

Title: The Sheltering Sky
Resume: An American couple travel abroad to revitalize their relationship. But as the trip drags on, their attempt at recovering what they once had seems futile.

Title: Catch a Fire
Resume: A drama about terrorism in Apartheid-era South Africa, revolving around a policeman and a young man who carries out solo attacks against the regime.

Title: Un dimanche à Kigali
Resume: In April 1994, the middle-aged Canadian journalist Bernard Valcourt is making a documentary in Kigali about AIDS. He secretly falls in love for the Tutsi waitress of his hotel Gentille, who...See full summary»

Title: Professione: reporter
Resume: Unable to find the war he's been asked to cover, a frustrated war correspondent takes the risky path of co-opting the identity of a dead arms-deal acquaintance.

Title: Heatstroke
Resume: On a family trip in the African desert, a research scientist unintentionally travels off course and is brutally murdered by an arms dealer. His girlfriend is put to the ultimate survival ...See full summary»

Title: Skin
Resume: Based on the true story of a black girl who was born to two white Afrikaner parents in South Africa during the apartheid era.

Title: Shake Hands with the Devil
Resume: The story of General Romeo Dallaire's frustrated efforts to stop the madness of the Rwandan Genocide, despite the complete indifference of his superiors.

Title: The Wooden Camera
Resume: A township near Cape Town. Two young teens, Madiba and Sipho, find a gun and a camera. Sipho takes the gun, and Madiba the camera, sealing their fate.

Title: Goodbye Bafana
Resume: Goodbye Bafana is the true story of a white South African racist whose life was profoundly altered by the black prisoner he guarded for twenty years. The prisoner's name was Nelson Mandela.

Title: Black Hawk Down
Resume: The story of 160 elite U.S. soldiers who dropped into Mogadishu in October 1993 to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord, but found themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.

Title: Le secret de Chanda
Resume: A touching mother-daughter relationship that reflects the modern South Africa.

Title: Daratt

Title: Things of the Aimless Wanderer
Resume: Late nineteenth century, a white explorer is lost in the jungle. He sets off, trying to locate himself. In the thick rain forest, he encounters a young woman... Early twenty-first century, ...See full summary»

Title: Guelwaar
Resume: Burial of a Christian political activist in a Muslim cemetary forces a conflict imbued with religious fervor. A satiric portrayal of religion and politics, sometimes humorous, sometimes deadly serious.

Title: Amistad
Resume: In 1839, the revolt of Mende captives aboard a Spanish owned ship causes a major controversy in the United States when the ship is captured off the coast of Long Island. The courts must decide whether the Mende are slaves or legally free.

Title: Amandla! A Revolution in Four Part Harmony
Resume: Interviews, archival footage, and filmed performances highlight the role of music in the South African struggle against apartheid.

Title: Badou Boy
Resume: Sarcastic look at Senegal's capital following the adventures of a somewhat immoral street urchin.

Title: Nirgendwo in Afrika
Resume: A German Jewish refugee family moves to and adjusts to a farm life in 1930s Kenya.

Title: Heremakono
Resume: The story of two people who cross paths in Nouhadhibou.

Title: Keita! L'héritage du griot
Resume: A storyteller named Djeliba comes to the town of a young boy named Mabo with promises that he will reveal the origin of the boy's ancestry.
